title: C90-3063

sentences.text: Manual acquisition of semantic constraints in broad domains is very expensive .
This paper presents an automatic scheme for collecting statistics on cooccurrence patterns in a large corpus .
To a large extent , these statistics reflect semantic constraints and thus are used to disambiguate anaphora references and syntactic ambiguities .
The scheme was implemented by gathering statistics on the output of other linguistic tools .
An experiment was performed to resolve references of the pronoun `` it '' in sentences that were randomly selected from the corpus .
The results of the experiment show that in most of the cases the cooccurrence statistics indeed reflect the semantic constraints and thus provide a basis for a useful disambiguation tool .

Entity-this_paper.label: This paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper describes an automatic scheme for collecting statistics on cooccurrence patterns in a large corpus to aid in the disambiguation of anaphora references and syntactic ambiguities.

Entity-an_automatic_scheme_for_collectin.description: An automatic methodology designed to gather and analyze statistics on cooccurrence patterns within a large linguistic corpus, aimed at reflecting semantic constraints to aid in the disambiguation of anaphora references and syntactic ambiguities.

Entity-scheme.label: scheme
Entity-scheme.description: The scheme refers to an automatic method for collecting statistics on cooccurrence patterns in a large corpus, which is used to reflect semantic constraints and assist in disambiguating anaphora references and syntactic ambiguities.

Entity-automatic_scheme.label: automatic scheme
Entity-automatic_scheme.description: The 'automatic scheme' refers to a method for collecting statistics on cooccurrence patterns in a large corpus, which is used to reflect semantic constraints and assist in disambiguating anaphora references and syntactic ambiguities.

Entity-these_statistic.label: these statistics
Entity-these_statistic.description: These statistics refer to the collected data on cooccurrence patterns in a large corpus, which reflect semantic constraints and are utilized for disambiguating anaphora references and syntactic ambiguities.

Entity-an_experiment.label: An experiment
Entity-an_experiment.description: An experiment refers to a specific study conducted to resolve references of the pronoun 'it' in randomly selected sentences from a corpus, utilizing cooccurrence statistics to reflect semantic constraints for disambiguation.

Entity-the_result_of_the_experiment.label: the results of the experiment
Entity-the_result_of_the_experiment.description: The results of the experiment refer to the findings obtained from analyzing cooccurrence statistics in a corpus, demonstrating their effectiveness in reflecting semantic constraints for disambiguating pronoun references.

Entity-the_corpus.label: the corpus
Entity-the_corpus.description: The corpus refers to a large collection of text data used in the study to gather statistics on cooccurrence patterns for the purpose of resolving semantic ambiguities in language.

Entity-sentence.label: sentences
Entity-sentence.description: In this context, 'sentences' refers to individual linguistic constructs that were randomly selected from a large corpus for the purpose of conducting an experiment aimed at resolving anaphora references, specifically the pronoun 'it'.

Entity-cooccurrence_statistic.label: cooccurrence statistics
Entity-cooccurrence_statistic.description: Cooccurrence statistics refer to quantitative measures that analyze the frequency with which certain words or phrases appear together in a given dataset, often used in linguistic and data analysis to infer relationships and patterns.

Entity-a_useful_disambiguation_tool.label: a useful disambiguation tool
Entity-a_useful_disambiguation_tool.description: The entity 'a useful disambiguation tool' refers to a system that utilizes cooccurrence statistics from a large corpus to automatically resolve ambiguities in language, particularly in disambiguating anaphora references and syntactic ambiguities.

Entity-cooccurrence_pattern.label: cooccurrence patterns
Entity-cooccurrence_pattern.description: Cooccurrence patterns refer to the statistical relationships and frequencies with which certain linguistic elements, such as words or phrases, appear together within a given dataset or corpus.

Entity-manual_acquisition_of_semantic_co.label: Manual acquisition of semantic constraints in broad domains
aliases: Manual acquisition of semantic constraints in broad domains
Entity-manual_acquisition_of_semantic_co.description: The phrase 'Manual acquisition of semantic constraints in broad domains' refers to the labor-intensive process of gathering semantic constraints across various fields, which is highlighted as costly in the context of the paper discussing an automatic alternative for this task.

Entity-large_corpus.label: large corpus
Entity-large_corpus.description: A large corpus refers to a substantial collection of written or spoken texts used for linguistic analysis, research, or training in various applications such as natural language processing.

Entity-corpus.label: corpus
Entity-corpus.description: A corpus is a structured collection of written or spoken texts used for linguistic analysis and research.

Entity-linguistic_tool.label: linguistic tools
Entity-linguistic_tool.description: Linguistic tools refer to software and methodologies used in language processing to analyze and gather statistics on linguistic data, which aid in tasks such as disambiguation of references and syntactic ambiguities.

Entity-broad_domain.label: broad domains
Entity-broad_domain.description: Broad domains refer to extensive areas of study or fields in which semantic constraints are manually acquired, highlighting the challenges and costs associated with this process.

Entity-semantic_constraint.label: semantic constraints
Entity-semantic_constraint.description: Semantic constraints refer to the rules or limitations that govern the relationships and meanings of words and phrases in language, which are essential for understanding context and resolving ambiguities in linguistic expressions.

Entity-manual_acquisition.label: manual acquisition
Entity-manual_acquisition.description: Manual acquisition refers to the labor-intensive process of gathering semantic constraints across broad domains, which is noted for its high cost and complexity.

Entity-anaphora_reference.label: anaphora references
Entity-anaphora_reference.description: Anaphora references are linguistic expressions that refer back to previously mentioned entities or concepts within a discourse, serving to maintain coherence and clarity in communication.

Entity-expensive.label: expensive
Entity-expensive.description: The term 'expensive' refers to the high cost associated with the manual acquisition of semantic constraints in broad domains.

Entity-disambiguation_tool.label: disambiguation tool
Entity-disambiguation_tool.description: A disambiguation tool is a software application designed to clarify the meaning of ambiguous terms or phrases in language by utilizing various linguistic techniques and data.

Entity-syntactic_ambiguity.label: syntactic ambiguities
Entity-syntactic_ambiguity.description: Syntactic ambiguities refer to instances in language where a sentence or phrase can be interpreted in multiple ways due to its grammatical structure.

Entity-very_expensive.label: very expensive
Entity-very_expensive.description: The term 'very expensive' refers to the high cost associated with the manual acquisition of semantic constraints in broad domains.

Entity-pronoun.label: pronoun
Entity-pronoun.description: A pronoun is a linguistic term that refers to a word used to replace a noun or noun phrase in order to avoid repetition and to indicate grammatical relationships.

Entity-statistic.label: statistics
Entity-statistic.description: Statistics refers to the branch of mathematics that deals with the collection, analysis, interpretation, presentation, and organization of data.

Entity-experiment.label: experiment
Entity-experiment.description: An experiment is a systematic and controlled procedure conducted to investigate hypotheses, test theories, or explore phenomena, often involving the manipulation of variables to observe effects.

Entity-result.label: results
Entity-result.description: Results refer to the outcomes or data obtained from a study, experiment, or analysis that provide insights or evidence regarding a specific hypothesis or question.

Entity-paper.label: paper
Entity-paper.description: A paper is a written work that presents research findings, theories, or analyses, typically published in an academic or professional context.

summary: Manual acquisition of semantic constraints in broad domains is very expensive . This paper presents an automatic scheme for collecting statistics on cooccurrence patterns in a large corpus . To a large extent , these statistics reflect semantic constraints and thus are used to disambiguate anaphora references and syntactic ambiguities . The scheme was implemented by gathering statistics on the output of other linguistic tools . An experiment was performed to resolve references of the pronoun `` it '' in sentences that were randomly selected from the corpus . The results of the experiment show that in most of the cases the cooccurrence statistics indeed reflect the semantic constraints and thus provide a basis for a useful disambiguation tool .

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' serves as a linking verb that establishes an identity or a state of being between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject possesses the quality, characteristic, or condition described by the object, effectively equating the two in the context of the statement.

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates that the subject is introducing, showcasing, or making known the object, which typically represents an idea, concept, method, or finding. This connection implies that the subject is providing information or a proposal to the audience regarding the object, often in a formal or structured manner.

Predicate-collects.label: collects
Predicate-collects.description: The predicate 'collects' indicates an action performed by the subject that involves gathering or accumulating items, data, or information, which are represented by the object. It signifies a process where the subject actively seeks out and aggregates the specified object, often for analysis, study, or record-keeping purposes.

Predicate-reflect.label: reflect
Predicate-reflect.description: The predicate 'reflect' indicates a relationship where the subject embodies, represents, or demonstrates the qualities, characteristics, or implications of the object. It suggests that the subject serves as a mirror or representation of the object, conveying or illustrating its essence or significance.

Predicate-are_used_to_disambiguate.label: are used to disambiguate
Predicate-are_used_to_disambiguate.description: The predicate 'are used to disambiguate' indicates that the subject provides a means or method for clarifying or resolving ambiguity in the object. It suggests that the subject plays a role in making the object more understandable by distinguishing between different interpretations or meanings.

Predicate-was_implemented_by_gathering.label: was implemented by gathering
Predicate-was_implemented_by_gathering.description: The predicate 'was implemented by gathering' indicates that the subject, which can be a plan, strategy, or system, was put into effect through the process of collecting or assembling specific data or information, represented by the object. This suggests a methodical approach where the act of gathering serves as a foundational step in the execution or realization of the subject.

Predicate-was_implemented_by_gathering_s.label: was implemented by gathering statistics on
Predicate-was_implemented_by_gathering_s.description: The predicate 'was implemented by gathering statistics on' indicates that the subject has been put into effect or executed through the process of collecting and analyzing quantitative data related to the object. This suggests a methodological approach where empirical evidence or statistical information is utilized to inform or support the implementation of the subject.

Predicate-were_selected_from.label: were selected from
Predicate-were_selected_from.description: The predicate 'were selected from' indicates a process of choosing or extracting specific items (the subject) from a larger set or source (the object). It implies that the subject is a subset or a result of a selection process that originates from the object, highlighting a relationship where the object serves as the source or basis for the selection.

Predicate-show_that.label: show that
Predicate-show_that.description: The predicate 'show that' indicates a relationship where the subject provides evidence or demonstrates the validity of the object. It implies that the subject presents information, findings, or conclusions that support or confirm the existence, truth, or relevance of the object in question.

Predicate-provide_a_basis_for.label: provide a basis for
Predicate-provide_a_basis_for.description: The predicate 'provide a basis for' indicates that the subject serves as a foundational element or support that enables, facilitates, or justifies the existence, development, or functionality of the object. It implies a relationship where the subject contributes essential information, principles, or resources that are necessary for the object to be effective, operational, or meaningful.

Predicate-provide.label: provide
Predicate-provide.description: The predicate 'provide' indicates a relationship in which the subject supplies, offers, or makes available the object, which serves as a resource, tool, or benefit to the recipient or context implied by the subject.

Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' indicates that the subject provides an account, explanation, or representation of the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject conveys information about the characteristics, functions, or details of the object, thereby enhancing the understanding of the object through the perspective of the subject.

Predicate-is_a_type_of.label: is a type of
Predicate-is_a_type_of.description: The predicate 'is a type of' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or category that falls under the broader classification represented by the object. It implies that the subject shares common characteristics or functions with other entities that are categorized under the object, thereby situating the subject within a larger conceptual framework.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates a hierarchical relationship where the subject is a specific instance or subset that falls under a more general category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider range of concepts or entities than the subject, thereby situating the subject within a broader context.
